page.title: 12Bridport's Rivers.
page.content: The River Brit, with its source north of Beaminster, flows through Bridport and enters the sea at West Bay Harbour. Its major tributary, the Asker, enters Bridport from the north-east and joins the Brit near Palmer's Brewery. The River Simene enters Bridport from the north-west and joins the Brit near St.Mary's playing field. All three rivers contain brown trout and are visited by migratory trout. Syndicates rent water from landowners, but arrangements to fish can be made with individual farmers. In the lower reaches of the river below the confluence of the Brit and Asker, saltwater fish such as flounders and grey mullet are caught. Eels are found in all waters.
